examples.title: Subtracting Complex Numbers
examples.problem_text: What is the difference of complex numbers 22 - 14i and 7 - 3i?
examples.answer_explanation:
Subtract complex numbers by combining like terms.

Step 1: Set up the subtraction
(22 - 14i) - (7 - 3i)

Step 2: CRITICAL - Distribute negative sign to BOTH terms
= 22 - 14i - 7 + 3i

Step 3: Combine real parts
22 - 7 = 15

Step 4: Combine imaginary parts
-14i + 3i = -11i

Step 5: Write final answer
15 - 11i

COMMON MISTAKE:
Forgetting to distribute negative:
22 - 14i - 7 - 3i = 15 - 17i ✗

The answer is B.

examples.title: Multiplying Complex Numbers
examples.problem_text: What is the product of complex numbers 1 - 3i and 11 + 2i?
examples.answer_explanation:
Use FOIL to multiply complex numbers.

Step 1: Use FOIL
(1 - 3i)(11 + 2i)
First: 1 × 11 = 11
Outer: 1 × 2i = 2i
Inner: -3i × 11 = -33i
Last: -3i × 2i = -6i²

Step 2: Combine
= 11 + 2i - 33i - 6i²
= 11 - 31i - 6i²

Step 3: Replace i² with -1
i² = -1, so:
11 - 31i - 6(-1)
= 11 - 31i + 6

Step 4: Combine real parts
= 17 - 31i

CALCULATOR SHORTCUT:
Type directly: (1-3i)(11+2i)
Press ENTER → get answer!

The answer is D.

examples.title: Simplifying with Complex Conjugate
examples.problem_text: Which of the following is equivalent to 5/(3 + 4i)?
examples.answer_explanation:
Use complex conjugate to remove i from denominator.

Step 1: Identify conjugate
Denominator: 3 + 4i
Conjugate: 3 - 4i (flip sign of imaginary)

Step 2: Multiply top and bottom by conjugate
[5/(3 + 4i)] × [(3 - 4i)/(3 - 4i)]

Step 3: Multiply numerator
5(3 - 4i) = 15 - 20i

Step 4: Multiply denominator (shortcut!)
(a + bi)(a - bi) = a² + b²
(3 + 4i)(3 - 4i) = 3² + 4² = 9 + 16 = 25

Step 5: Simplify fraction
(15 - 20i) / 25
= 15/25 - 20i/25
= 3/5 - 4i/5

The answer is A.

examples.title: Adding Complex Numbers
examples.problem_text: What is the sum of (8 + 5i) and (5 - 2i)?
examples.answer_explanation:
Add complex numbers by combining like terms.

Step 1: Set up the addition
(8 + 5i) + (5 - 2i)

Step 2: Group like terms
= 8 + 5 + 5i - 2i

Step 3: Combine real parts
8 + 5 = 13

Step 4: Combine imaginary parts
5i + (-2i) = 5i - 2i = 3i

Step 5: Write final answer
13 + 3i

Note: Addition is simpler than subtraction
because you don't need to distribute negatives!

The answer is B.

examples.title: Product of Complex Conjugates
examples.problem_text: What is the product of 2 + 3i and 2 - 3i?
examples.answer_explanation:
Use conjugate product shortcut.

Method 1: Shortcut (FAST!)
For (a + bi)(a - bi) = a² + b²
(2 + 3i)(2 - 3i)
= 2² + 3²
= 4 + 9
= 13

Method 2: FOIL (slower)
(2 + 3i)(2 - 3i)
First: 2 × 2 = 4
Outer: 2 × (-3i) = -6i
Inner: 3i × 2 = 6i
Last: 3i × (-3i) = -9i²
= 4 - 6i + 6i - 9i²
= 4 - 9i²
= 4 - 9(-1)
= 4 + 9 = 13

Both methods work!
Shortcut is much faster.

The answer is D.
